sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Speculum scripturale schismaticorum or, A scripture looking--glasse, most exactly characterizing all sorts of schismaticks: wherein, as, in a looking-glass, face answers face; so, scriptures paint seducers root and race: And, that they are the seedmen of all evil; and, must be shun'd, as serpents, or the Devil. Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for T.M., London : 1649.
Signed at end: John Vicars. The words "As, in a ... root and race:" and "And, that they ... or the Devil." are gathered in braces on the title page. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug: 8". Reproduction of the originals in the British Library.
=======
Speculum scripturale schismaticorum or, A scripture looking--glasse, most exactly characterizing all sorts of schismaticks: wherein, as, in a looking-glass, face answers face; so, scriptures paint seducers root and race: And, that they are the seedmen of all evil; and, must be shun'd, as serpents, or the Devil. Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for T.M., London : 1649.
Signed at end: John Vicars. The words "As, in a ... root and race:" and "And, that they ... or the Devil." are gathered in braces on the title page. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug: 8". Reproduction of the originals in the British Library.
T.M.
